title.narrative: Initial Gambia Post Election Population Return Response

description.narrative: ADRA did Food Distribution to 250 households at Brikama Community. Each household will receive the following food aid:- 50kg rice, 0.5kg Salt, 4kg Sugar, 15kg beans, and 5ltrs oil.

The Gambia’s December 1, 2016, Presidential election ended in a deadlock when the sitting president who lost the elections refused to step down for the opposition candidate who was declared as the winner of the elections by the electoral commission. The fear of an outbreak of war caused over 79,500 to flee to neighboring Senegal and Guinea Bissau for protection. With the president finally agreeing to leave to country on January 21, 2017, as of January 24, about 29,500 refugees have returned. Most of these refugees went away to seek refuge with all their saving which had been spent. Some as a result of lack of funds are stranded on the borders of the country. Many who have finally got to their homes have met it looted and are out of money to care or their family by providing food. This was complicated by the high increase of the prices of commodities especially food. According to the UN, about 75% of the refugees are women and children.
